data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Data Centre Policy 2021 - Data Centre Parks - Electricity Supply - Existing
data.benefits: This scheme provides exemption on Dual-grid lines power supply and Transmission and wheeling charges.
data.eligibility:
1. A Minimum 40 MW Data Center capacity for locating Data Centre Units will be considered under the Data Center.

2. Data Centre Park Developer who is engaged to build the facility of DC park covering land, park area (Water, Sewage, Road, Parking, Green Area, etc.)
data.conditions:
1. Policy is applicable for the proposals submitted after the notification of this policy. 

2. Investors shall not be eligible to claim financial incentives under the same head from Central and State Governments both. 

3. All incentives and benefits proposed under the policy shall be applicable post release of Letter of comfort. 

4. This subsidy shall be given to only first 3 DC parks after notification of the policy.

data.nodal_agency: Department of IT & Electronics, Government of Uttar Pradesh
data.context: The Policy aims to build a conducive policy environment for the Data Center industry to flourish in the state. The locational advantage, strong IT ecosystem, readily employable quality talent are some of the key ingredients to keep Uttar Pradesh a promising destination for investment in Data Center industry.
data.objective:
1. Drive necessary regulatory, structural and procedural interventions for enabling ease of doing business in the sector, towards attracting investments and accelerating the existing pace of Data Centre growth in the country. 

2. Meet the data security needs by promoting investments in trusted (safe and secure) Data Centres in India. 

3. Facilitate standardization in the development of Data Centres
data.description:
Scheme provide assistance for: 

  1. Dual Power Grid Network: The first 3 Data Center Parks will be provided with dual-grid power supply. 
  2. Wheeling and Transmission Charges Exemptions: 50% Exemption on wheeling/transmission charges for intrastate power sales for 25 years from the commissioning date of the project. 
  3. 100% Exemption on wheeling/transmission charges for intrastate transmission systems used for interstate power sales, applicable for 25 years. 
  4. 100% Exemption on transmission charges for import of energy from outside the state for 5 years, applicable only to projects commissioned during the policy period (5 years).
data.how_to_apply: Application form- https://invest.up.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/ViewGOPDF_list_user-27.pdf to be submitted to nodal agency
data.funding_facilitator: Empowered Committee, Department of IT & Electronics, Government of Uttar Pradesh
data.funding_mechanism: On verification and approval of application, amount shall be disbursed to the applicant.
data.additional_info:
1. UP-based Data Center MSMEs and startups in cloud business can avail benefits under UP MSME Policy or Startup Policy. 

2. Non-Financial Incentives: 

a. Mission Critical Infrastructure: DCs classified under Essential Services and Maintenance Act (ESMA) for uninterrupted operation. 

b. Water Supply: 24x7 water supply ensured by Industrial Area Development Authorities for DC units inside and outside parks. DC parks to establish water treatment plants as part of infrastructure. 

c. Special Provisions in Building Norms: Sub-leasing allowed without additional charges for DC units. 3.0+1.0 purchasable FAR; basement and DG installation excluded from FAR. No floor-to-ceiling height restriction (subject to regulations). Rooftop chillers permitted, subject to safety clearance. Parking space requirement reduced to 5% of the total built-up area, with conditions. Ground coverage up to 60% allowed for DC parks/units. Essential infrastructure (electricity, water, roads) provided by Industrial Authorities. 

d. Electricity Supply: Open access for power procurement. Cross-subsidy surcharge progressively reduced over five years to 20%. DC park developers eligible for power distribution licenses. 24x7 power supply ensured, with renewable energy imports allowed. 

e. Other Support: Non-disturbance provision to ensure business continuity. Preference for registered DC units in government cloud storage procurement. 24x7 operations permitted, including employment of women in all shifts. Self-certification for compliance under select labor laws (e.g., Factories Act, Shops & Establishments Act).
